channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: No new cases of Covid-19 as NZ prepares to enter level 2
item.description: There have been no new cases of Covid-19 reported in New Zealand as the country prepares to enter alert level 2.

item.title: Live Covid-19 updates from New Zealand and around the world on 12 May
item.description: Jacinda Ardern says Cabinet considered an exemption to tangi and funerals but found it too difficult to be able to carve out rules and exemptions around that.

item.title: Level 2: Delay in reopening bars a 'kick in the guts'
item.description: Bars and music venues will be doing it tough, owners say, but the level 2 travel rules are good news for tourist spots like Rotorua.

item.title: Former Auckland Council employee sentenced to home detention for accepting bribe
item.description: A former Auckland Council employee has been sentenced to home detention over bribery and corruption charges.

item.title: Level 2 cold comfort for wedding planners, funeral directors
item.description: Rules that allow people to burst bubbles, but only in groups of up to 10, will mean very little for mourners hoping to attend a funeral, those planning a wedding, and church services.

item.title: First arrest in Tongariro bones discovery
item.description: Police have charged a man in connection to the death of a man found buried in a shallow grave near Tongariro.

item.title: Takeaways are back - and so is the waste caused by disposable packaging
item.description: Kiwis have re-claimed takeaways, but at what cost to the environment? Disposable coffee cups are overflowing rubbish bins.

item.title: Covid-19: Strained social services brace for even further demand
item.description: Social services fear some of their funding sources are about to dry up, just as more people need help amid the fallout from Covid-19.

item.title: Ministry of Social Development investigating after Work and Income benefit bungle
item.description: The minister has ordered an investigation after what appears to be decades of benefit applicants wrongly being rejected until their redundancy ran out.

item.title: Covid-19: What happened on 11 May
item.description: Monday brought news that many people have been waiting to hear - you'll soon be able to interact with people outside your bubble. Here's what else happened.

item.title: Covid positive traveller jailed after refusing medical examination
item.description: Checkpoint - A woman who tested positive for Covid-19 had been in an Auckland jail for 10 days after refusing to be examined when she arrived from the United States.

item.title: Wellington sewage pipe repairs mean turd taxi trucks' end
item.description: Wellington's turd taxis may be off the city's streets in two weeks, as progress on repairs to a collapsed pipe have surged ahead.

item.title: Budget 2020: $151 million funding boost for early learning services
item.description: Early learning services are getting a $151.1 million funding boost in Budget 2020 to improve the pay of up to 17,000 qualified teachers.

item.title: Social services urge govt to boost benefits as poverty rises
item.description: Auckland's Papakura Marae has seen dozens of families arriving at its doors each day seeking emergency help and support since the lockdown.

item.title: Alert level 2: Finance Minister Grant Robertson answers questions
item.description: Checkpoint - Finance Minister Grant Robertson answers questions surrounding the upcoming move to alert level 2, and what it will mean for people, businesses and sports.

item.title: Covid-19: PM Jacinda Ardern reveals staggered move to alert level 2
item.description: Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern has announced a staggered move into level 2 starting on Thursday, with schools and bars reopening later and groups limited to 10 people.

item.title: Cabinet weighs the evidence for New Zealand's shift to level 2
item.description: New Zealanders have a nervous wait today as the government makes the call this afternoon whether to move to level 2, or stay in level 3 lockdown a while longer.

item.title: Budget 2020: Govt to boost pharmaceutical funding by $160m
item.description: The government is going to give pharmaceutical funding a $160 million boost over the next four years.
